rubric_items.description: The response must define autophagy, including its normal role in cellular turnover, specifically mentioning degradation and recycling of cellular components, and maintaining cellular homeostasis by removing damaged organelles and protein aggregates.
The response must describe the dual role of autophagy in cancer, including both tumor suppression and promotion, with context on how these roles change during cancer progression.

The response must explain if the autophagy process can be targeted with cancer treatment, providing at least one reference with a PMID if available.

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re considering telehealth support groups. Are these as effective as in-person groups?

questions.question_text: My husband has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with treatment-related sleep problems. What can help improve sleep quality?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we want to understand more about cancer cachexia. How is this different from regular weight loss?

questions.question_text: My father has pancreatic cancer and his doctors mentioned epithelial-mesenchymal transition. What is this?

rubric_items.description: The response must describe epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) as a transformation where epithelial cells acquire mesenchymal characteristics.

questions.question_text: My mother has pancreatic cancer and we’re trying to understand the role of the microbiome. How does this affect cancer and treatment?

rubric_items.description: The response should define the microbiome as the microorganisms that live in the body and play roles in digestion, immune function, metabolism, and inflammation.

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with treatment-related mood changes. Is this common and how is it managed?

rubric_items.description: The response should state that mood changes are very common with the diagnosis of pancreatic cancer.

questions.question_text: My husband has pancreatic cancer and we want to understand more about tumor suppressor genes. How do these relate to cancer development?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re considering professional counseling. What type of counselor should we look for?

rubric_items.description: The response must recommend discussing mental health counseling with the oncology team to connect with local resources.

questions.question_text: My father has pancreatic cancer and his doctors mentioned DNA damage response pathways. How do these relate to treatment options?

questions.question_text: My mother has pancreatic cancer and we’re trying to understand the role of inflammation in cancer progression. How is this managed?

rubric_items.description: The response must clearly define inflammation using terms such as “immune response,” “tissue injury,” or “protective mechanism.”

The response must describe at least two medical strategies for managing inflammation, such as “targeted therapies,” “immunotherapies,” “steroids,” or “pain management.”

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with medication management challenges. What systems can help organize this?

rubric_items.description: The response should mention using a pill organizer with compartments for different times of the day and days of the week.

questions.question_text: My husband has pancreatic cancer and we want to understand more about oncogenes. How do these contribute to cancer development?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re trying to understand treatment sequencing. Does the order of treatments matter?

questions.question_text: My father has pancreatic cancer and his doctors mentioned hypoxia in tumors. What does this mean for treatment?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with end-of-life planning. What should we consider and when?

questions.question_text: My mother has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with complex family dynamics around medical decisions. How do we navigate this?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we want to understand more about circadian rhythms in cancer. How do these affect treatment timing?

The response must explain the effect of poor or inadequate diet on circadian rhythms, mentioning that irregular eating can disrupt circadian rhythms and that maintaining regular meal times is important.

The response must recommend that the patient consult a nutritionist familiar with nutritional challenges associated with pancreatic cancer.

questions.question_text: My husband has pancreatic cancer and we’re trying to understand the role of mitochondria in cancer cells. How does this relate to treatment?

questions.question_text: My loved one has pancreatic cancer and we’re dealing with insurance coverage for experimental treatments. What options do we have?

The response must recommend that the patient and/or family become familiar with their insurance policy to understand what is or is not covered.

questions.question_text: My father has pancreatic cancer and his doctors mentioned ferroptosis. What is this type of cell death and how does it relate to treatment?
